content.raw:
This is great! It solves the issue of inheritance.

My only concern with having operators for the underlying data type is if two components that have the same underlying data type want to serialize differently. So if `JointVelocityCmd` and `JointForceCmd` use `std::vector<double>`, we would create `operator<<` for `std::vector<double>`, but the same `operator<<` will be used for both components. I can't think of when this might be an issue, and it's **really** nice to be able to share serializers, but it might also be nice to have the choice whether to share or not.
